title: Edo Queens Win Nigeria Women League Title For First Time
body_text:
Edo Queens have won the Nigeria Womenâ€™s Football League (NWFL) championship for the first time in club history.
The Benin-based team drew 1-1 with Bayelsa Queens in their final NWFL Super Six playoff encounter, bringing their total points to 10 from five games. They won four games and lost one.
Moses Adukuâ€™s girls won their first title at the Samson Siasia Stadium in Bayelsa State after Rivers Angels were unable to upset Heartland Queens in a 1-1 draw on the final day.

With the victory, Edo Queens will represent Nigeria in the West African Football Union (WAFU) tournament, which acts as a qualifying round for next seasonâ€™s CAF Womenâ€™s Champions League.
